There is a motion sensor light on the house but it doesn’t go on until you are pretty close. It took us 3 times around the block and a call with the host to actually find it. Then we had to shine our headlights on the lockbox to adjust the code and get to the keys. It was intimidating driving into the neighborhood at night. I don’t think it would have been alarming had we checked in during the day but not knowing our surroundings late at night with very few lights around was unnerving.

Richie was a great host, very responsive to our questions. Next time we are in this area we plan to stay here again. We visited in July, and the weather was wonderful, especially compared to back home in AL!
The cabin is as rustic as it appears in the ad yet was very comfortable. Being well off the main road, it was private and very quiet in the area. Road traffic was minimal on the river road.
Interestingly decorated with lots of memorabilia, the house is full of character and things to see. I kept thinking it reminded me of Cracker Barrell! The living room is very comfortable. Upstairs, there were lots of games in case you need something to do on a rainy day. A large screen smart TV completes the room and includes a game set.
The deck is overly expansive relative to the furnishings, and it was very nice to sit out there, especially in the evening. There is a nice view toward the mountains across the river, but no actual river view from the unit. There was a nice breeze and lots of birds singing all day long. We spent a lot of time out there, chatting with our friends.
It is a bit of a hike downhill to the river, but the area is very well kept and a great place to hang out. There is a fire pit you can grill on if you want. Access to water is easy, and the river was very beautiful.
The kitchen was pretty well equipped and served our needs just fine, as we usually cook about half our dinners and all of breakfast meals when we stay in a cabin.
Bathrooms had lots of countertop space for our things and there was ample lighting and storage. Water pressure was a bit too high. I would say the shower was piercing! But much better than not enough pressure, which is often an issue at a remote cabin.
Lots to see in the area, and the local restaurants are very good. I highly recommend this place it you are seeking river adventure or interested the history of the area.

This rustic cabin was exactly as advertised: a rustic cabin in the woods. It is comfy, roomy, and has a lot of character. I loved the beautiful stained glass window over the main door, and how it glowed as the sun came up.
My family (me and my husband, and my parents and their dog) used it as a base for hiking in the nearby Cumberland Gap National Park, and it was perfect. It was a short drive to the park, grocery store and restaurants, yet we felt like we were really in a peaceful, back-to-nature setting.
The gas stove in the kitchen was nice, and there was a lot of storage for groceries, in addition to a nicely stocked pantry that contained many cooking ingredients, like spices, oils and vinegars. We did a lot of our cooking at the cabin, making use of the grill and crockpot. There were knives, cutting boards, a variety of pots and pans, and a nice selection of cooking utensils.
The beds were very comfortable, with nice bedding, and the towels were nice, too.
The deck was where we spent much of our time--the view was lovely, and we saw many cardinals and even a couple of bald eagles.
There was a great selection of games and books for the couple of rainy days we experienced, which was nice, and the dining room table is big enough for both family meals and games or puzzles.
Richie was quick to respond to any questions we had, and his instructions for checking in, etc. were very clear.
If you are looking for a Holiday Inn type of experience, this is probably not the best choice, but if you are looking for solace in the woods, then I would highly recommend.

review_text: Unique ambience in a beautiful, secluded location in the middle of the Tennessee mountains. The smell of cedar upon entering only adds to the already rustic vibe of the cabin, and it is outfitted with almost anything you think you could need while you are away from home. If it’s not—the owner is just a text message away, and is very responsive to his guests. They also offer experiences for a marginal fee, such as kayaking, fishing, mountain biking, etc. We didn’t use these services while we were there, as we had a really full schedule, but there are nature experiences to be had for the taking. Like the rest of the house, the bed I slept in was extremely comfortable, and there is even a laundry room there to use for extended stays or if your clothes get wet or dirty. Overall, an excellent experience in a sublime location, and a place that I plan to return to in the future!

The house was cute, and the creek/dam outside was nice. That said, I will not stay here again next time I'm in the area.
The house has structural issues and is very crooked. As a result, the floors are very uneven and some of the doors do not close. The kitchen has low drop ceilings, and an odd countertop arrangement that makes it awkward to squeeze through to the bedroom off the kitchen. There is a water pipe going through a closet, grout popping out of floor tiles because of the uneven floors, lots of things like that.
The decor is bright and cute, and for some people the structure issues probably aren't a big deal for a trip. The house was well equipped with everything you would need.
I think this property depends on the kind of person you are. If you're not going to sweat the details and just want a cute place to hang out, go for it! If you're in construction like me, the details will probably drive you crazy, though!

Every day we started before sunrise and went late into the night exploring and taking in so many things that the area has to offer. Hiking, kayaking, scenic drives, great food, amazing sunrises, sky-on-fire sunsets and elevated Mountain Vista‘s and pinnacles that will take your breath away!
Amy is awesome! The cottage is awesome! The setting is awesome! The surrounding area to explore is awesome! I guess what I’m saying is… We had an awesome time… and… We will absolutely head back to our “second home“ in the future.
Tommy & Becky Campbell

review_text: I am so glad this place happened upon me! I was trying to book places and left and right they kept booking at the same time I'd try to book. then I came across this beautiful little cottage, tucked away in the Kentucky mountains. I healing from a lot physically and spiritually. it was a shot, and rejuvenating stay. i arrived late coming from Michigan, after rereading Jacquelines directions since Google misdirected me to the town near by. lesson, Jacqueline is through and should be listened to over Google 😂😉 this place re-entered me. my first morning I sipped coffee on the porch, soakinh in the view, smells, and feels of it all. then I went into a deep meditation. this is usually difficult for me. here I felt safe and grounded. I came out of my meditation to a humming bird flying right infront of my face!! the cottage is full of things to help you with relaxing, healing, meditation, and true self care. I also had a small issue with the AC unit not wanting to turn off. a simple message to Jacqueline, she came to the door, chatted with me to my hearts content, and came back with a remote with new batteries. a simple fix, that she was happy to do and would definitely gone further to get fixed if needed. shes local and knows the area and her guide book is a great one to reference. while it's tucked away, it's not fully secluded. making a solo traveler like myself feel a lot better. I highly recommend this sweet space for your mountain stay for evey reason! the hostess is open hearted and genuine, the location is prime, the beds comfy, and the water pressure Devine! Iwill hopefully be returning here one day. much gratitude to you Jacqueline and the mountains. I needed this stop in my life. 💜
